metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20067 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A renderer initiated back navigation was incorrectly allowed to cancel a browser initiated one in Navigation in Google Chrome prior to 71.0.3578.80 allowed a remote attacker to confuse the user about the origin of the current page via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20067` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '74.0.3729.169-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
